Citizens can also monitor requests, provide comments and follow other requests in their community. Duplicate requests are also absorbed for easy, workflow management. Download the free app today to get started or visit www.publicstuff.com for additional information.

name: PubliVate
Description: PubliVate is about online collaboration and engagement.  Whether it is end to end Community Engagement involving the design, deployment, and running of online public or private collaborative communities to crowdsourcing to collaborative issue management to small scale collaboration through ConVersations, we are pleased to have earned our spot as the leader in helping our clients to work smarter.

name: PulsePoint
Description: Where adopted, the PulsePoint app empowers everyday citizens to provide life‚Äêsaving assistance to victims of Sudden Cardiac Arrest (SCA). Application users who have indicated they are trained in cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) and willing to assist in case of an emergency can now be notified if someone nearby is having a cardiac emergency and may require CPR. If the cardiac emergency is in a public place, the location-aware application will alert trained citizens in the vicinity of the need for bystander CPR simultaneous with the dispatch of advanced medical care. The application also directs these citizen rescuers to the exact location of the closest publicly accessible Automated External Defibrillator (AED).

name: Raise Your Voice
Description: Our web tool, embeddable in online news sites, blogs, and advocacy pages, connects citizens, politicians, and interest groups to further political activism and the democratic process.  We believe that people are most inspired to political action when reading or watching the news. (Who doesn't grumble at the TV or newspaper once in a while?). To capture these moments of inspiration, we created a web based tool that allows people to easily write to their elected officials and connect with like minded organizations.

name: RapidSMS
Description: Group SMS technology platform

name: RBT Megakheir
Description: RBT Megakheir uses ringback tones to replace the normal beeping tone one listens to while calling someone with a piece of music or advertising tone that is chosen by the party being called. This RBT is content selected carefully with the aim of raising people‚Äôs awareness about NGOs and their projects and activities.

name: Reachous
Description: Reachous is a mobile web application that runs on mobile and desktop browsers. There is no download required to use Reachous, simply navigate to reachous.com with your mobile or desktop browser.  When visiting reachous.com, your browser will ask if you want to share your location data with the app. If you agree, many categories of data that Reachous provides will be enhanced with location-aware features.

name: Real Time Congress
Description: OpenCongress makes it easier to understand, track, and engage with Congress. OpenCongress combines official government data with news and blog coverage, social networking, and participation tools to give you the real story behind what's happening in Congress.

name: Real Time Warning Pro
Description: Get alerts about disasters around the world. Select an event to see its location, damage, severity, and rumble radius on a world map. Tap once on an event for detailed view and links to sharing on social networks. 'Felt' and 'damage' distances are approximations only. Data is collected from a wide variety of sources including the US Geological Survey, NOAA, and many other sources from around the globe. Real Time Warning Pro has added PUSH notification features to help update users as fast as possible while maintaining optimal use of their gps, data and overall usage of their devices. View earthquakes, cyclones, volcanic eruptions, hurricanes, floods and other natural disasters on an interactive map. Features include: +Real time warnings of natural disasters +Set custom disaster alarms +Set monitors for earthquakes, Cyclones, Volcanic Eruptions, Hurricanes, Floods +Share option with FaceBook and Twitter Connect +GPS

name: RealTimeCrime
Description: Realtimecrime is the only truly real time,fully interactive social networking application capable of interacting with governmental agencies to both send and receive alerts of emergency incidents in the user‚Äôs proximity. Realtimecrime automatically notifies you immediately when an incident occurs in your vicinity. Incident notifications include: Crimes, Fires, Road Closures/Detours, Infrastructure Interruptions (water, power, communications, etc.), Emergency Notifications, Weather Event Notifications, Natural Events and other Incidents which require immediate and widespread announcements.

name: RECLAMOS
Description: Reclamos crowdsources consumer complaints to create and publish consumer satisfaction rates for Chilean companies and government agencies.

name: ReCollect
Description: Recollect is a simple solution to remembering garbage day. Recollect will send you a reminder, via email, iCal feed, Twitter, text message or phone call, at the time of your choosing the day before your garbage day. Our goal is to simply make people's lives a little easier by helping them not have to remember when to take out their garbage and recycling.

After the initial pouring of sympathy and aid when the disaster struck, the flood is becoming a distant memory. Through this game we hope to remind people that there is work still to be done, homes yet to be rebuilt and lives yet to be put back on track.

name: Reroute.it

Reroute.it is a mobile web application, meaning that it is not a native app that is specific to a mobile platform. Any user with a smart phone can simply go to http://reroute.it and immediately use it for free. Calculates cost, time, calories burned, and emissions of walking, biking, transit, taxi, and driving Reroute.it is a mobile web application that works on all mobile platforms

name: Reutilizer
Description: How do people interested in using recycled waste and biofuel figure out when a restaurant has some available? This team from the University of Wollongong in Dubai in Dubai has created the Reutilizer, a mobile application and website that uses a mapping algorithm to make waste collection by individuals and stores more efficient.

name: Ride The City
Description: Welcome to Ride the City, a website that helps you find safer bike routes in cities. Like other mapping applications, Ride the City finds the shortest distance between two points, with a difference. First, Ride the City avoids roads that aren't meant for biking, like highways and busy arterial streets. Second, Ride the City tries to steer cyclists toward routes that maximize the use of bike lanes, bike paths, greenways, and other bike-friendly streets.

name: rideSF
Description: RideSF provides bike routes that heavily favor bicycle lanes in San Francisco.  RideSF.com is meant to help cyclists find safe (city sanctioned) bicycle directions in San Francisco.

name: ROVIR

name: SAHANA

Sahana Eden‚Äôs features are designed to help Disaster and Emergency Management practitioners to better mitigate, prepare for, respond to and recover from disasters more effectively and efficiently. name: Sahana Mayon
Description: Mayon provides an emergency personnel and resource management solution that is highly scalable to manage large numbers of events, persons and resources. Its intended to serve professional emergency management organizations in large municipalities and jurisdictions charged with preparedness, response, recovery and mitigation responsibilities.

name: SanJoseClean
Description: SanJoseClean places the power of City Government in the palm of your hands. Easily report issues such as graffiti to the City of San Jose along with a photo and GPS location. Your request will automatically be routed to the correct department. Opt in to receive notifications and we will let you know when the issue has been cleaned up. Thank you for helping to take the time to keep San Jose Clean.

name: Say-Now

name: SB Code

Scenario 360 helps you view, analyze and understand land-use alternatives and impacts.

name: Scout
Description: A tool that allows you to create customized keyword alerts to notify you whenever issues are included in legislative or regulatory actions.

name: Seafood Watch App
Description: Always choose the most environmentally friendly fish in any season. This app gives you information on the fishery status and market for various types of fish as well as alternative suggestions. sustainablog (http://s.tt/1xVaK)

name: Seasonal Harvest
Description: Each week you‚Äôll get a new list of the seasonal fruits and vegetables in your area so you can shop for the freshest local goods. sustainablog (http://s.tt/1xVaK)

name: SeeClickFix
Description: SeeClickFix is a free mobile phone and web tool that allows citizens to report non-emergency issues, to communicate with public officials, and to engage with fellow citizens to help find solutions to problems in their neighborhood or town. Reported issues are displayed on a web-based map along with tools which allow other citizens to add comments, suggest resolutions, or add video/pictorial documentation. Anyone can receive email alerts on these issues based on a filter by geographical area and keyword. SeeClickFix also provides a platform for curated crowdsourcing and community reporting.

name: SEEDS
Description: Seeds is a revolutionary social game that facilitates direct mobile-to-mobile microlending from the developed to the developing world, or even in your own backyard.  Gamers can explore an immersive playable world, communally rebuilding a virtual civilization while simultaneously microlending money to boost real entrepreneurs.  Seeds gamifies microlending, using fun incentives to motivate players to greater generosity.

name: ServeNet
Description: a volunteer management tool for nonprofits

name: SFMuni
Description: Providing timely, convenient, safe and environmentally friendly transportation alternatives in San Francisco, CA.

name: Shadow
Description: an anonymous web browser, it is possible to browse without revealing the source or destination of your Internet traffic.

name: Shareabouts
Description: Shareabouts is a mapping tool to gather crowd sourced public input. Use it to collect suggested locations and comments, in a social, engaging process.  Shareabouts is ideal for crowdsourcing bikeshare stations and gathering input on wayfinding projects.

name: Shark Net
Description: The flow of information won‚Äôt stop once it hits the lab. The Stanford team has released a new iPhone and iPad app called Shark Net to model the sharks‚Äô patterns and offer real-time notifications when the robot crosses paths with certain sharks. name: Sheltr.org
Description: A mobile-friendly web app that uses your current location to provide people with the ability to help the needy find the closest available food, shelter, medical care or any basic human need. The app is targeted toward agencies, individuals serving people in need, and the public who want to help the hungry or homeless. Currently there is no way to gauge real-time availability of food and shelter services for these disparate groups. The Sheltr Project establishes consolidated baseline information (service availability), contact for intake centers, and specific instructions to access resources.

name: Shop Ethical!
Description:
Get the low-down on the environmental and social record of companies behind common brand names. Shop at the supermarket with a clear conscience!
The most popular digital guide to ethical shopping in Australia, Shop Ethical! has been completely redesigned to provide consumers with the easiest way to make informed purchasing decisions.

name: ShowMe
Description: ShowMe is a global learning community - a place where anyone can learn or teach anything.

name: Simply Solar
Description: SimplySolar is a solar panel alignment app designed to increase the viability of solar energy and positively change the lifestyles of people in developing countries. As of right now it is more economically viable to buy more solar panels than buy a solar tracking system that automatically aligns solar panel/solar thermal heaters. SimplySolar replaces expensive alignment tools and solar tracking systems with a clever algorithm and a few tools to aid in manually adjusting a solar panel to increase the amount of energy output by up to 30%, helping create sustainable communities with a higher standard of living.

name: Sitegeist
Description: What do you know about your neighborhood? Sitegeist, a new mobile app designed by the Sunlight Foundation and IDEO, might help you learn a little more. The app draws from publicly available data on everything from demographics, to the average cost of rent, to recommended restaurants. All of the information is displayed in easy-to-read graphics.

name: Sithi
Description: Sithi is a Cambodian human rights portal that aims to crowdsource and curate reports of human rights violations.

name: Sleep Time
Description: Azumio, a company behind a suite of popular biofeedback apps, recently released this sleep tracker, which uses the iPhone's built-in accelerometer to monitor your movements throughout the night. name: Social Simulator

name: SocialBlood
Description: A new app in India is using Facebook to facilitate blood donations between people of the same type in emergencies.  Socialblood uses Facebook to connect people of the same blood group, facilitating blood donations in emergency situations.

name: SocialTXT
Description: SocialTXT takes advantage of the unused space in "Please Call Me Messages" to post informative social messages, such as the contact number for the National AIDS Helpline.

name: Solar Panel Suitability Checker

SolarCity is a web-based application that uses Esri mapping software to calculate solar potential for rooftops. With this tool, basic calculations can demonstrate the cost saving opportunities brought by a switch to solar power. Any city with the necessary geodata can use this application to spread public awareness of the benefits of solar energy and take an important step towards greater energy efficiency.

name: Sourcing Through Texting
Description: "Sourcing through Texting" provides a way to connect citizens with journalists via mobile phones. It allows people to communicate with journalists by sending tips or information via text message in response to story topics or specific questions.

name: Spacehive
Description: Spacehive is an online funding platform for neighbourhood improvement projects, which makes it as easy for communities to buy a new park or playground as buying a track on iTunes. The aim is to put communities in the driving seat of neighbourhood planning. Spacehive achieves this by providing a tool that gives communities collective financial clout to deliver popular projects independently of councils.

name: Speak2Tweet
Description: Speak To Tweet or speak2tweet is a communications service which allows users to leave a "tweet" on Twitter by calling a designated international phone number and leaving a voice message. The service was developed to help people stay connected when an Internet connection is unavailable, specifically in response to the Internet shutdown during the 2011 Egyptian revolution.[1] Speak2tweet service has launched for Syria on 30th Nov 2012.

name: Spoken Web
Description: The World Wide Web enabled quick and easy information dissemination and brought about fundamental changes to various aspects of our lives. However, a very large number of people, mostly in developing regions, are still untouched by this revolution.  Spoken Web is an entire platform that lets ordinary phone subscribers create and deploy their own applications and services over a simple phone call. It can be used to proliferate IT information and transactional services to masses on existing IT/Telecom infrastructure. It requires no additional cost of ownership to end users other than an ordinary phone.

name: Spot Reporters
Description: Spot Reporters enables mobile users to become a local government's eyes and ears by "deputizing" citizens to report potholes, graffiti, and other non-emergency issues using their mobile phone. City governments receive support to customize Spot Reporters to fit their specific needs. name: Sproutster

name: Stamen Crimespotting

If you hear sirens in your neighborhood, you should know why. Crimespotting makes this possible with interactive maps, e-mail updates, and RSS feeds of crimes in areas that you care about. name: Stomp
Description: Award-winning STOMP, or Straits Times Online Mobile Print, is Asia's leading citizen-journalism website with user-generated material fuelling its success. name: Survey Solutions

name: Sustainable Brands

name: Sustainable Living

Though the original site was built for UK parlimentary monitory, the code behind it can be adopted for any location.

name: Think Local
Description: Think Local is a Lancaster Chamber led, community wide initiative to improve our local economy by encouraging consumers and business decision makers to support local businesses when making purchases. The primary goal of Think Local is to stimulate and accelerate the local economy by encouraging business decision makers and consumers to keep their dollars local, where the impact can be significant as dollars recirculate locally.

name: Throw It Out the Window
Description: The result of Wu‚Äôs epiphany a year ago is the cheeky and informative food scandal database Throw It Out the Window, a homegrown resource that tries to alert the Chinese public to the many dangers lurking at the supermarket and on the restaurant table.  The site and other tech tools like it, including a new iPhone app that gives daily news feeds about the latest food scandals, underscore the deep anger in China over the country‚Äôs persistent food safety problems and a new willingness among ordinary people to take the matter into their own hands.

name: Tiendatek
Description: Tiendatek is an accounting and inventory management tool for small shopkeepers in the developing world. It runs on Android phones and connects to our servers for backup and business advice. The applications will be installed on phones which will then be distributed locally and financed by Microfinance Institutions. In addition, Frogtek will offer an internet-based service to provide the micro-entrepreneur with real-time reporting, analysis, and personalized recommendations to improve business and increase profits.

name: Timely
Description: In Japan, which is still reeling from the earthquake and tsunami in March, Apple just released news that its new iOS 5 operating system will allow users the option of receiving early earthquake notifications on their iPhones. The warning app plugs directly into Japan's national earthquake warning system, one of the most advanced in the world, and can buy iPhone users anywhere from seconds to minutes to prepare. That's not a lot, but it's at least time enough to get out of a building or move to higher ground.

name: Touch to Give
Description: This site allows you to donate money to causes without actually spending money. When you touch one of the cause icons, the app‚Äôs ad sponsors will donate money to the cause. You can also shop on the site to donate even more. Some of the causes include breast cancer, animal neglect, global hunger, and more.

name: Trak-it
Description: The TRAKiT e-government solution is a powerful, easy-to-learn municipal software package for counties, cities, and towns to streamline code enforcement, government licensing, land management, code management, and more.

name: Trees Near You
Description: Trees Near You helps you learn about more than 500,000 trees that live on New York City sidewalks. For any area of the city, from block to borough, you can see the different species that live there, and measure the environmental (and monetary!) benefits that these trees provide.

name: TrixBox
Description: TrixBox offers two options, TrixBox CE and TrixBox Pro. TrixBox CE is an open telephony platform that combines the best of the open source telephony tools into one easy-to-install package. Based on an enhanced LAAMP (an open source bundle of Linux¬Æ, Apache‚Ñ¢, Asterisk¬Æ, mySQL¬Æ, and PHP), the TrixBox dashboard provides easy to use, Web-based interfaces to setup, manage, maintain, and support a complete IP-PBX system

name: True Food Shopper's Guide
Description: The mobile app was created to help you find and avoid GE ingredients wherever you shop. Our guide gives you valuable information on common GE ingredients, brands to look for, and look out for, and common sense tips to keep you in the know. Stop shopping in the dark and download your new pocket shoppers‚Äô guide today!

name: Tuna in Trouble
Description:
‚Äé‚ÄèImagine you are an Atlantic bluefin tuna. Imagine you have to escape for your life from the fishing nets‚Ä¶ Now stop imagining and grab this exciting game ‚Äì become the tuna and save yourself by swimming through holes in the fishing nets.

‚Äé‚ÄèGlobally tuna populations are in trouble. Many species are endangered or critically endangered. There simply aren't enough fish to sustain the world's voracious appetite for tuna. Rampant over-fishing and pirates stealing tuna are pushing the ocean's "natural torpedoes" to the brink of extinction.

name: Txteagle
Description: Txteagle is a data collection and engagement platform that leverages mobile airtime compensation for data collection and customer engagement. It is currently used by one nonprofit organization to survey constituents about disaster preparedness.

name: U.S. Presidents
Description: Learn about the U.S. presidents - years in office, birthplace, trivia, party, vice presidents and more. Test yourself with Quiz mode. Find presidents by search or index. Kick-back and enjoy a presidential parade!

name: Uchaguzi
Description: Uchaguzi (‚Äúdecision‚Äù in Swahili) was developed to monitor Kenya's 2010 constitutional referendum.

name: Understoodit
Description: a new web-based app called Understoodit wants to take the fear out of learning by allowing students to anonymously communicate confusion.  The creator of Understoodit, Toronto-based software developer Liam Kaufman, used to be one of those students who didn't want to "look like an idiot by saying I was confused in front of two hundred classmate," he says. To solve the problem, he developed the app, testing it out on first-year computer classes at the University of Toronto.   To use Understoodit, a teacher simply sets up an account, then grants students access to log in through their smartphones, tablets, or laptops. As the teacher lectures, the students can click two options, "understood" or "confused." The program funnels real-time data back to the teacher's laptop, enabling her to re-explain and boost the class' comprehension.

name: UNIEQ
Description: The UNIEQ App unfolds its full potential in conjunction with an intelligent meter and the UNIEQ-System! Please note:  If not connected to a UNIEQ system, you can run the App in the offline mode. No data will be shown.

name: United Way NE
Description: The mission of United Way of Wayne County is to increase the capacity of the people of Wayne County to care for one another by identifying human needs and supporting programs that have the greatest impact on improving lives. Priority program focus areas include Education; Health & Wellness; Financial Stability; Community Enhancement & Stabilizing Personal Crisis. These are the building blocks for a better life for many people in our community.

name: UP2CODE
Description: UP2CODE is an easy way for San Francisco residents to report and track non-emergency code enforcement issues to the Office of the City Attorney. Residents can be proactive by using the app to collaborate with the San Francisco City Attorney's Office in improving their neighborhoods. Together we can make San Francisco a safe and beautiful place to live, work, and play!

name: Urban Farming Update
Description: Ever wanted to have complete control over your food and feed your family Healthy, organic meals at virtually no cost? Well, now you can... When you become an Urban Farmer! This app was designed to provide you with up to date information about Urban Farming, Livestock in the city and provide helpful instructions for the beginning Urban Farmer.

name: Urbanflow Engine
Description: Urbanflow Engine is a decision-making and planning tool for professionals in city planning departments, non-profit organizations, and private consulting companies who work on planning for new investments in urban infrastructure projects.  We have built a customizable spatial analysis tool that helps compare different scenarios using user-supplied data and inputs from public data sources.  The analysis is done through our web-based User Interface and simulation technology. We use modern web technologies and support import of open data to conduct scenario analysis, measure network efficiency and emissions, and generate insights on usage to help in planning for future investments through scenario analysis.

name: UrbanGardenshare
Description: Facilitates the matching of interested gardeners with space in community gardens or other agricultural space throughout the City. The current issue is that that demand often builds up for well known garden spaces (in the form of multi-year waiting lists) and startup gardens have trouble attracting enough involvement.

name: Ushahidi
Description: The Ushahidi Engine is a platform that allows anyone to gather distributed data via SMS, email or web and visualize it on a map or timeline.

name: Ustad Mobile
Description: Smartphone software designed to improve literacy among women in Afghanistan has been launched and rolled out to 100 students for free.  Ustad Mobile, also known as Mobile Teacher, is the brainchild of Afghan IT consultancy Paiwastoon Networking Services and the Ministry of Education, and was developed using $80,000 (¬£50,400) in US aid. It's hoped the software will be a major step towards the government's target of achieving 48 percent literacy among those over 15, by 2015. According to CIA figures, just 28.1 percent of those aged over 15 can read and write, and only 12.6 percent of women can read.  The software, which teaches two languages -- Dari and Pashto -- and has mathematics tutorials, is targeting the country's 18 million mobile contract subscribers -- a fair chunk of its 30.4 million-strong population

name: Ustream Live Broadcaster
Description: Your humble iPhone 4 becomes a HD television camera with live broadcaster. Film protests as they happen and stream them live to the world. Who needs Sky News with its multi-million cameras and satellite uplink vans ‚Äì this is citizen broadcast journalism.

name: Verde
Description: Verde lets you take an inventory of the electrical appliances, gadgets, and lights you already have, and then calculates the total energy consumption along with the expected costs (based on your local electricity rates). Choose your appliances from their list, or add your own, and then customize the data to your liking. The app then suggests changes you can make to save both energy and money.

name: Vibe
Description: Vibe is a revolutionary mobile app for discovering and participating in the vibe around you, whether in a conference, concert, rally, building, neighborhood, campus, or even the iPhone 5 line. Yes, it's that flexible and that powerful.   Vibe users communicate via messages that have a GPS location, a broadcast distance, and a time duration - without registration, login, account, or profile.

name: Visualization Explorer
Description: The space shuttle program may be over, but NASA's ability to inspire the next generation of science, technology, engineering and math experts is as strong as ever. On Tuesday they released a free iPad app, the Visualization Explorer, which "allows users to easily interact with extraordinary images, video, and information about NASA's latest earth science research."   Designed by media specialists at the NASA Goddard Space Flight Center in Greenbelt, Maryland, the app's incredible visuals come from computer images based on data captured by NASA's satellites. The app has the potential to make teaching and learning about science a lot cooler.

name: Voice of Real Change
Description: The MDC‚Äôs Information and Publicity department this week launched The Voice of Real Change, an audio service that will give the people of Zimbabwe a new and exciting platform to know what is happening in the country and in their party.     A first by any political party in the country and in the region,the MDC will provide an audio platform that will herald a new era in communication at a time when the socalled public broadcaster, the ZBC, has shamefully become a conveyor-belt of Zanu PF propaganda. Under the new communication platform, Zimbabweans will call a set of cellular phone numbers. The numbers will cut and the call-back facility will enable the radio system to call back to listeners who will then receive guidelines that will lead them to exciting options.

name: Voices of Africa
Description: Mobile reporting implies using the mobile phone as a powerful reporting tool to capture, edit and uploads text, photo and video content!

name: Volunteer Action Center
Description: The Volunteer Action Centre of Kitchener Waterloo and Area is a registered charity that has developed our community‚Äôs capacity for volunteerism since 1984. We create and facilitate resources and relationships between our members (registered charities and not-for-profits) and the community. These resources include: our (500+ position strong & updated daily) volunteer opportunity database, sharing best practices through Executive Directors‚Äô and Volunteer Managers‚Äô Networks, and regional training via VAC and the Waterloo Wellington Learning Alliance.

name: Volunteer Impact
Description: Supports recruiting, tracking qualifications, scheduling and recording hours, reporting, communications, automation and volunteer engagement.

name: Volunteer2
Description: Hosted Volunteer management software.

name: VolunteerHub
Description: Volunteer Registration and management system.

name: VolunteerMatters
Description: Hosted volunteer management platform.

name: Vota Inteligente
Description: Vota Inteligente in Chile promotes government transparency by informing Chilean citizens about corruption and policy debates through the use of social media.

name: VOTEBD
Description: Vote BD tracks and disseminates information about politicians and electoral candidates in Bangladesh.

name: VOTENAWEB
Description: Votenaweb allows citizens to compare their vote on congressional bills with the politicians'.

name: Voto
Description: VOTO amplifies the voice of the under-heard. Using SMS or voice services in local languages, our innovative notification and survey platforms are improving communication between African citizens and the governments, aid organizations, and businesses that serve them. VOTO is also used to send reminder alerts to citizens about health issues.

name: Walkonomics
Description: How walkable is your street, neighbourhood or city? Walkonomics is a web-app that rates and maps the pedestrian-friendliness of streets and urban areas by combining Open Data and Crowdsourcing. So far, Walkonomics has a rating for every street in New York and England (thats over 600,000 ratings). Each street is rated in the following eight categories: - Road safety; - Easy to cross; - Pavement/Sidewalk quality; - Hilliness; - Navigation; - Fear of crime; - Smart & beautiful; - Fun & relaxing.  Ratings are automatically generated from Open Data and then refined using real peoples reviews. So why not see how walkable your street is and add your own rating.

name: Waste Nothing
Description: Waste Nothing allows anyone to look up how to dispose of any item. Search easily, and resulting suggestions can be for city services such as garbage and recycling, as well as other options such as reuse and donation. Maps to locations are shown where applicable and tips can be shared through social media. Waste-related events can be listed as well. Easy to set up and administer. A search widget is available which can be included on any web page including ones from third parties such as local news and environmental organizations.

name: WeTap
Description: The WeTap app, currently available for Android smartphones, allows users to bookmark drinking fountains using GPS and Google Maps, rate the quality of the faucets, and share the news with other users. Using an early prototype of the WeTap app, Wendel recruited students from UCLA‚Äôs Institute of Environmental Studies and set to work mapping drinking fountains on her alma mater‚Äôs campus. Then, she extended her reach to cover the state of California. She‚Äôs since set her sights on mapping the entire United States. And after partnering with the OpenMaps project in the U.K., the project is flourishing on two continents.

name: Wikimapa
Description: With the help of five young "wiki-reporters" and GPS-equipped mobile phones, the nonprofit is building a map of five Brazilian favelas: Complexo do Alem√£o, Cidade de Deus, Morro do Pav√£o-Pav√£ozinho, Morro Santa Marta and Complexo da Mar√©.  By uploading information to the phones, the reporters are mapping the unmapped, one road and cafe at a time.  "We wanted to spread the news about what slums do have, so all the people can get to know that the slum is not just a place for violence and marginality and robbery."

name: WinSenga
Description: Infant mortality is a serious problem across the globe, so this team from Makere University in Uganda has created a mobile phone app that can help midwives examine expectant mothers by checking a baby‚Äôs heartbeat and size.

name: WiserEarth
Description: WiserEarth is an NGO directory and social networking platform that maps and connects organizations and individuals working for the environment, social justice and human rights.

name: Women's Shelter Case Management Software
Description: Women's Shelter Case Management Software from Osnium provides a comprehensive case management system for shelters. It features modules to track clients, calls, donations, staff and more

name: World Disasters

name: WorldLens
Description: Word Lens translates printed words from one language to another with your smartphone's video camera, in real time.  No network connection needed!

name: YAKB.us

name: Yardshare

The current issue is that that demand often builds up for well known garden spaces (in the form of multi-year waiting lists) and startup gardens have trouble attracting enough involvement.

name: YouTown
Description: Big-time metropolis? Small-budget township? YouTown brings a ready-made mobile platform to connect with your citizens to ANY community. Connecting busy citizens to their local governments can be tough. As more and more people rely on their mobile devices for handling day-to-day information and tasks, many cities are asking, ‚ÄúHow can we take the initiative and make civic data available to our citizens in a mobile format?‚Äù The answer is simpler than you might think. No need to build your own application or break the budget. YouTown provides the platform, you provide the data -- and your community reaps the benefits.

name: Zanby
Description: Zanby is a free individual and group organizing platform. Individuals and organizations can start or join unlimited groups, use a robust events management system, upload documents and photos, manage group members, and more.

name: Zilino
Description: Zilino‚Ñ¢ (http://zilino.com), a social web app for large-scale deliberative community dialogues. Built on the principles of good process, Zilino allows practitioners to design and host custom participation experiences that are manageable, productive and fun. Zilino is set to launch in beta in the Fall of 2012.

name: Zipcar App
Description: Full-scale integration of car sharing might be a long way off in America, but, now that the free Zipcar App for iPhone and iPod Touch is available, it's gotten one step closer. The app uses a Google Maps interface to provide information about available cars, and it's gotten mostly favorable coverage from Coolhunting and PSFK.Seeing as how most of our cars sit idle and empty of passengers for some 22 hours a day, and seeing as how pretty much the entire infrastructure of this country has been built with cars in mind, simplifying car sharing is a great idea.
